title: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
OB: When using code assist in a Java file with no suggestions, the file becomes dirty.
EB: If code assist has nothing to suggest, it should not cause the file to become dirty.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press Ctrl+Space.
